Annotated Bibliography.description: An annotated bibliography with a summary of sources with citations for argumentative papers

Argumentative Paper.description: An argumentative paper with a clear position supported by credible sources in a sequenced writing project

Belief Exploration.description: An exploration of the author's personal beliefs and experience as related to research or scholarship

Case Study.description: A summary of a decided legal case and argument regarding the decision

Controversy Analysis.description: An objective analysis of a controversy in society and the arguments made supporting multiple perspectives. Includes evidence from sources.

Counterstory.description: Counterstory is a multimodal storytelling, research, and reflection project that focuses on power dynamics in all of its intersectional forms and effects within the depicted situations.

Description and Explanation.description: A description and explanation of register choices made in a corresponding assignment ("Register Rewrite")

Digital Autobiography.description: A narrative reflecting on digital literacy development

Email.description: Emails to professors or other professionals

Film Analysis.description: An analysis of how a film achieves its purpose through rhetorical features such as, plot design, character development, setting, and visual aspects

Genre Analysis.description: An analysis of the characteristics of a particular genre, including register choices, organization, development, and multimodal elements

Genre Redesign.description: An adaptation of a previous writing project for a new genre. This project is sometimes accompanied by a reflective essay

Informative Paper.description: An analysis of a topic with the purpose of informing the reader without taking a side/position; demonstrates subject knowledge/control

Interview Report.description: An interview report on experts' opinions on students' research topics for synthesis and argument paper

Literacy Narrative.description: A narrative that describes a student's literary and/or language development in various academic and social contexts.

Literature Review.description: An organized review and/or synthesis of several articles on a related topic

Memo.description: A short summary of an article or topic intended for a professional (non-academic) audience

Narrative.description: A narrative reflecting on personal growth connected to experiences in a particular place

Open Letter.description: A letter intending to persuade a broad audience about a particular viewpoint on a contested topic

Position Argument.description: An argumentative paper with a clear position related to World Englishes supported by a mix of scholarly references and personal experiences

Profile.description: A focused overview of a specific person or organization

Public Argument.description: An argument intending to persuade a broad audience about a particular viewpoint on a contested topic, often in the form of a powerpoint or other digital format

Reflection.description: Course-level reflective writing, sometimes completed as part of a final portfolio

Register Rewrite.description: A transformed version of a formal academic article into an informal register/genre

Research Proposal.description: A proposal of research plans in a sequenced writing project, including working argument, backgrounds, and methods

Research Report.description: A report on empirical research, often including an IMRD format.

Rhetorical Analysis.description: A breakdown of a text into rhetorical components to better understand how an author achieves their purpose. Typically uses ethos, logos pathos.

Short Argument.description: A (short) argumentative claim about a topic that is of interest to the student. This is often extended for the Argumentative Paper.

Summary.description: A summary of a single article or media source

Summary and Response.description: A summary of a single article or media source and response to that source

Synthesis.description: A paper that reviews 3 published articles related to a research topic in a sequenced writing project

Synthesized Genre Analysis.description: A reflection on genre analysis that includes primary and secondary research on the genre

Text Analysis.description: An analysis of how literary devices are used to create a particular effect on its target audience

Variation Analysis.description: A comparative analysis of register differences between an academic article and an informal text
